definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: There has been an urgent need for people to obtain a systematic understanding of the contents of human rights.
sentences.chinese: 人們對人權法內容體系的瞭解也越來越迫切。

sentences.english: The declaration became the foundation of international human-rights law.
sentences.chinese: 《宣言》已成爲國際人權法的基礎。

sentences.english: Britain had maintained that human rights laws did not apply to its troops based outside Europe.
sentences.chinese: 英國政府堅持人權法不適合用在歐洲外的軍隊。

sentences.english: He told the court that MacD's living conditions are in violation of the European Convention on Human Rights.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴法院，麥克帝的情況已經違反歐盟人權法。

sentences.english: She will study law here and hopes to focus on culture-related subjects and human rights law.
sentences.chinese: 勳儀將會修讀法學，希望能專注於文化及人權法等。
